Name: Statuette of kneeling king
Description: The statuette of bronze represents a kneeling king, probably in adoration before the figure of a divinity which is now lost. He raises his arms which held an offering. The king is wearing a "nemes" head-dress that ends in a tail at the back. The Brussels piece closely resembles a statuette of the pharaoh Necho II (610-595 BC), preserved at the Brooklyn Museum (Brooklyn 71.11).
